intro: Mahernia deserti, commonly known as the desert mahernia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, drought-tolerant growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color, which bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in harsh desert environments. Mahernia deserti is often found growing in rocky soils and is well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
